content.description: Start up with a tough move or two and head to the left side of a hueco. The black rock in the hueco looks like some pretty scary choss but I guess it's alright. Tech up the rounded arete to the anchor.
content.protection:
5 bolts to anchor.

The 2nd draw is a fixed chain so you can lower through it while cleaning and keep yourself on the ledge.
content.location: Second route from the left on the ledge at the left side of The Morgue. It is just right of a new line (project, 12+ish) and just left of Death Certificate.

content.description: Start with some tough moves off the deck to get to some better holds and eventually follow jugs to the anchor.
content.protection:
5 bolts to anchor.

There is a chain draw at the first bolt so you can lower through it while cleaning to keep yourself on the ledge.
content.location: Rightmost route on the ledge at the left side of The Morgue. Right of Death Certificate and Left of Scalpel.

content.description: Twin cracks, the left crack peters out, climb the right crack in the dihedral the faces climber's left. Double rack to BD#0.5.
content.protection: One #5, and doubles down to BD#0.5.
content.location: This route is on the far right side of the crag. Start on top of a ledged formed by two counter balanced slabs of rock.

content.description:
Scramble up to a ledge and head up the short smooth dihedral to a good hold to clip the third draw. Head straight left on jugs with no feet to reach a ledge where you can relax and contemplate the rest of the route.

When you're ready, continue up the beautiful face and move through a tough move involving a narrow pocket. Get to a matched set of large pockets and get ready for the crux.

The guidebook says to used a pair of matched razor crimps - they're kind of sharp, but not awful. This isn't the only beta, as there are a couple of other holds in the area. The left crimp is pretty good if you can get your fingers into it (it's kind of a narrow slot crimp). The right crimp next to it is pretty miserable.

Whichever beta you choose, get to the good hold by the next bolt and follow easier ground to the anchors.

It's 13a in the guidebook but it seems a bit soft.
content.location: Just right of the ledge at the left side of the Morgue. Just left of Coroner.

content.description: Starts right of Coroner, obvious crux from bolts 2 to 3, easy but fun climbing from there to the chains. Equipped by Jake Veresh.

Start by climbing up through some chossy rock to slightly better rock and a challenging move above the third bolt.  Be prepared for some runout sections on less than vertical terrain with dirty and friable rock.
content.location: The approach trail to The Morgue follows the valley and heads right up a steep climb to the cliff face.  Turn left for this route and walk 10 to 20 feet to locate this route.  Turning right takes you to the main wall of The Morgue.

content.description: Challenging boulder problem to great movement and stemming on edges & pockets. Optional one bolt extension keeps the same grade
content.protection: 7 Bolts to Anchor. 1 Bolt extension optional.
content.location: Second route right of The Coroner which is identifiable by the hueco

content.description: Start out on pockets with some tough pulls which leads to a hueco and then to the top.
content.location: Second route from the right on the ledge at the left side of the crag.

content.description: Some big moves down low lead to a hard crux on the face underneath the arching dihedral / flake. Get through the crux and recover at a good stance before taking on the tough face climbing above. This one stays on you until the anchor.
content.location: Right of Post-Mortem and left of Cold Chamber (project). This line climbs the face under the large dihedral / flake.

content.description:
This route is incredible. Climb solid edges on beautiful golden rock to a well-defined crux sequence near the top of the climb. Climbs through a large hueco at about 20' off the ground.

This route was listed in the original MFRP guidebook as Rachel's Project.
content.location: On the long golden wall, right of Scalpel and left of Pathology.

content.description:
Start with some tough compression moves on a flake of sorts to gain some better holds. Keep moving up the face, encountering progressively more difficult climbing with the crux coming on crimps and shallow pockets. Climb into one of the most comfortable huecos ever and relax.

The route isn't quite over yet, as you need to climb to the finish with some reachy moves out of the hueco that turn into techy/slab movements to the anchor.
content.location: Right of The Incinerator and left of Post-Mortem; starts with some right hand sidepulls on a flake.

content.description: Arm fist crack in the rock house / right-facing dihedral
